text.text_translated:
Lewis wants to stop the damage to the sea. He wants to help the sea get better. This damage comes from things people do. He wants more 'sea protected areas'. These are parts of the sea that are safe. Now, only 3 per cent of the sea is a protected area. He wants this to be 10 per cent.

People damage the sea in many ways. They catch too many fish. They also pollute the water and throw rubbish in it. Lewis saw this damage on his trips.

He swam over coral reefs. Coral reefs are like gardens under the sea. Many small animals live there. The water is hotter now, so the coral reefs lost their color. They turned white. He also saw underwater deserts. There was no life there, only plastic.

Lewis thinks nature can get better. But it needs space to do this. We must act quickly. If we do not take care of our seas, we will soon have a very big problem. It will be a problem that we cannot solve.

best_attempt.text_translated:
Lewis wants to stop the damage to the sea. He wants more 'marine protected areas'. These are parts of the sea that are safe. Now, only 3 per cent of the sea is a protected area. He wants this to be 10 per cent.

People are damaging the sea. They catch too many fish. They also pollute the water and throw rubbish in it. Lewis saw this damage on his trips.

He swam over coral reefs. Coral reefs are like gardens under the sea. Many small animals live there. The water is hotter now, so the coral reefs lost their color. They turned white. He also saw underwater deserts. There was no life there, only plastic.

Lewis thinks nature can get better. But it needs space to do this. We do not have much time. If we do not take care of our seas, we will have a problem. It will be impossible to fix.
